subject: Career
title: The History of Remote Work
description: A quick, practical guide to The History of Remote Work.

hook.text: Remote work didn't start with COVID. Jack Nilles coined 'telecommuting' in 1973 during the oil crisis.

buildup.text: The idea was simple: bring the work to the worker instead of the worker to the work.

discovery.text: By 2019, only 5.7% of US workers were fully remote. Then 2020 happened and it jumped to 35%.

twist.text: The technology existed for years. It took a pandemic to override management's resistance to remote work.

climax.text: Post-pandemic, remote work settled at 12-15% fully remote with 28% hybrid ‚Äî a permanent structural shift.

punchline.text: Remote work was always possible. It just needed a catalyst.

quiz.question: Who coined the term 'telecommuting' and when?
